A Beginner's Guide to Google Cloud Platform & its Benefits

  • Report this article
Jenesis Jones

Jenesis Jones

Cybersecurity Professional | Security Analyst | Vulnerability Management Auditor | SIEM Analyst | Splunk

Published Feb 10, 2023
+ Follow

Are you a beginner looking to learn more about Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its benefits? Google Cloud Platform offers a wide range of services with a cloud-based infrastructure that can help your business grow and succeed. With GCP, you can access an array of cloud-based services such as computing, storage, data analysis, and more. This beginner’s guide to GCP and its benefits will give you the information you need to understand how GCP can help your business. You will learn about GCP’s features, benefits, and how to get started. With its flexible pricing and a range of free options, GCP is an ideal platform for small businesses and start-ups. With GCP, you can focus on creating innovative products or services without worrying about the technical aspects of running a business. You will also get access to a range of tools and services to help you get the most out of GCP. So let’s dive into this beginner’s guide and learn how GCP can help you succeed.

Benefits of using GCP

Like other cloud services, GCP has a number of benefits for businesses of all sizes. Some of these include:

Easy scalability. The components that make up GCP allow you to easily scale up or down resources as your business grows. Moreover, you can also choose to use a virtual machine to run specific applications and services that your business requires.

Reduced investment. With a cloud-based infrastructure, you avoid a large upfront investment in hardware, software, and staff. You only pay for the resources that you use, and you can scale your capacity up and down according to your business’ needs.

Reduced costs. You can use GCP to avoid costs associated with running and managing your own hardware and data centers. For example, you can avoid costs associated with managing hardware, managing cooling, and providing power. Furthermore, you can use remote monitoring and controls to easily manage your IT infrastructure from afar.

Standardization. With a cloud-based infrastructure, you can easily standardize your operations and processes. This allows your team members to focus on creating unique products and services for your customers.

GCP features and services

GCP is a complete solution for computing that includes major components such as Google Cloud Platform (CP), Google Cloud Storage, and Google Cloud Pub/Sub. CP offers a range of services that help you manage your data, stay connected, and collaborate with others. Some of these services include:

Computing. CP allows you to easily host and launch serverless applications with managed infrastructure. You can also use this service to analyze data and store or manage data.

Storage. With this service, you can easily manage your data with access control, encryption, and scalability. You can also use this service to store your application data or backup data.

Cloud Identity and Management. With this service, you can create user accounts, manage passwords and identities, and control access to resources.

Data Analysis and Infrastructure Monitoring. With this service, you can easily manage your analytics infrastructure and run data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Cloud ML, and Cloud Dataflow. Moreover, you can use this service to monitor your infrastructure for stability and performance.

Collaboration. With this service, you can easily create and manage multi-user collaborations. You can create templates for shared documents and tools, manage permissions, and keep track of activity.

GCP Pricing

GCP offers several pricing options, including:

Basic. This option includes the Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, and Data Transfer costs.

Standard. This option includes the Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, Data Transfer, and Networking costs.

Enterprise. This option includes the Standard features, 24/7 Technical Support, and Backup and Disaster Recovery costs.

Customizable. — This option gives you full control of the compute resources, storage, and networking costs.

Getting started with GCP

You can easily get started with GCP either through the Google Cloud Launcher or the Google Cloud Control Panel. Using the Google Cloud Launcher, you can create a new project or select an existing one. Once you have a project, you can manage the details such as billing account, project name, and project description. Next, you can create a project and create a project name for your project. After this, you can create a new project and select the country, project name, and project description. Now you can click Next and complete the rest of the project creation steps. For the sake of simplicity, you can follow the Google Cloud Platform setup guide to get started with GCP. The guide will walk you through the setup process for GCP. The setup guide covers everything from downloading the Google Cloud Platform setup tool to creating a project. Moreover, you can also request support from the Google Developer Mobile Support page.

GCP tools and services

GCP provides a wide range of tools and services to help you manage your projects and data. Some of these include:

Cloud Command Line Interface (CLI). You can easily use the Cloud Command Line Interface to perform common tasks such as creating or managing virtual machines, managing networks, or managing cloud resources. You can also use the Cloud CLI to perform common tasks such as creating or managing accounts, launching or managing applications, or managing services.

Cloud Shell. You can use this service to manage and monitor your projects. You can also use this service to manage projects that do not support the Cloud Console.

Cloud SDK. You can use this SDK to develop applications and manage your infrastructure. You can also use the Cloud SDK to implement authentication, create or manage files, or implement networking.

Cloud Vision API. You can use this API to train machine learning models to recognize text, images, and objects. You can also use the Cloud Vision API to analyze images or detect objects in images.

Cloud TPU. You can use the Cloud TPU to train machine learning models or run machine learning models on GPUs. You can also use the Cloud TPU to run machine learning models on supported hardware such as NVIDIA V100-series GPUs.

Cloud Monitoring. You can use this service to monitor the stability and performance of your cloud resources.

Cloud Firehose. You can use this service to transfer large amounts of data directly from your cloud resources.

GCP for Small Businesses and Startups

GCP provides many benefits for businesses of all sizes. However, for small businesses and startups, it provides an ideal solution to manage their cloud resources. GCP provides a range of tools and services to help you manage your cloud resources. Some of these include:

Scheduled tasks. With scheduled tasks, you can easily launch a VM or a batch job without waiting for the resources to become available. Moreover, you can easily create a job that runs every hour, day, or week.

Automatic billing. With automatic billing, you can easily manage your costs by charging only for resources that you use. You can also easily pause or cancel the billing if your project is not successful or if you encounter any issues.

Cloud-native apps. With cloud-native apps, you can easily create or manage apps that run on an open-source framework. You can also easily access an ecosystem of 3rd-party tools and services.

Hybrid apps. With hybrid apps, you can use both on-premises resources and cloud resources.

DNS and load balancer. With DNS, you can easily manage your DNS records and load balancers.

CDN. With Cloud Debug Network, you can easily debug your code by attaching a debugger, simulating a device, or running a test on remote devices.

GCP for Small Businesses and Startups benefits

The benefits of using GCP for small businesses and start-ups are numerous. The main advantages are that GCP provides a reliable and scalable infrastructure at an affordable price. It also provides great flexibility, scalability, and quick response times. GCP has a variety of features and services that help you manage your applications, data, and infrastructure. It also offers a wide range of pricing options to choose from. And, when you are done with your project, you can shut down the resources and they will become idle until a new project is ready to use them.

Common GCP Use Cases

As mentioned above, the main reason to use GCP is to reduce costs and increase productivity. Let’s now look at some of the common use cases of GCP.

Start-ups. GCP can help you launch your product or service faster. You can use it to test your ideas and develop a product that meets customer needs. You can also use it to scale up quickly.

Business Intelligence Applications. Advanced analytics can help your business make better decisions. This can help you do things like predict customer behavior and identify inefficiencies in your organization.

Data Storage and Processing Applications. This is where you can use GCP to store and process large amounts of data. This can help you analyze and discover insights from large amounts of data.

Website Hosting. With a website hosted on GCP, you can delegate the technical work to experts while focusing on the business aspects. You can also use it to scale up your website quickly.

Software Development. With the latest development tools, you can code your products and services. You can also use it for testing and managing your code.

PaaS and SaaS Applications. One of the main features of GCP is that it supports both PaaS and SaaS applications.

GCP Security

Security is a crucial aspect of any business decision and technology choice. The risk of losing your data, assets, and reputation is too high. That’s why Google takes security very seriously. Every time you use Google Cloud Platform, you get an advantage of the best security practices. The platform uses industry-standard security practices such as cryptography, network access controls, and data loss prevention. Google uses multiple layers of security including network access controls, data loss prevention, and access control. For example, when you use a client library, you get static code analysis. This helps detect potential security issues such as buffer overflow and format string vulnerabilities.

Conclusion

GCP offers a wide range of services to help your business succeed. It has been used by millions of businesses and helps reduce costs, increase productivity, reduce risk, and scale up faster. With GCP, you can access a range of tools and services such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, and advanced analytics. You can also store and process large amounts of data. The benefits of using GCP are significant and include cost savings, increased productivity, reduced risk, and flexibility. It has a proven track record and has been used by millions of businesses around the world. This means that you can trust the technology and go with your usual business process. Google Cloud Platform offers a variety of benefits for a wide range of use cases. It also has the best security practices implemented to protect your data and assets.
